prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Maps of DC3N 10-9 in L1544 and L1527
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Obtain maps of the DC3N 10-9 line towards L1544 and L1527. The H-13-C3N falls in the same band.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The line widths for L1544 and L1527 are about 1.5 km/s.

We request an angular resolution of 2arcsec so that we will be able to disentangle the emission from the disk versus the envelope in L1527. In L1544, we expect more extended structures so that we may, if necessary, reduce the angular resolution by smoothing over a larger beam.

We request an rms of 4mJy over a 0.5 km/s bin, based on the IRAM-30m single-dish observations. Specifically, the computed total flux is of 350 and 780 mJy in L1527 and L1544 respectively. Assuming a source extent of 10 and 15 arcsec leads to a flux on the 2" ALMA beam of 14 and 15 mJy, for L1527 and L1544 respectively. The 4mJy rms will ensure the detection of the DC3N line with about S/N=4 in the regions with the weakest line flux. Should the actual S/N be smaller, we will integrated over a larger beam, as the goal of the proposal is to disentangle the region of line emission to correctly compute the DC3N/HC3N.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Maps of HC3N 10-9 in L1544 and L1527
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Obtain maps of the HC3N 10-9 line towards L1544 and L1527.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The line widths for L1544 and L1527 are about 1.5 km/s.

We request an angular resolution of 2arcsec so that we will be able to disentangle the emission from the disk versus the envelope in L1527. In L1544, we expect more extended structures so that we may, if necessary, reduce the angular resolution by smoothing over a larger beam.

We request an rms of 10mJy over a 0.5 km/s bin, based on the IRAM-30m single-dish observations. Specifically, the computed total flux is of 3.5 and 8 Jy in L1527 and L1544 respectively. Assuming a source extent of 10 and 15 arcsec leads to a flux on the 2" ALMA beam of 150 and 170 mJy, for L1527 and L1544 respectively. The 10mJy rms will ensure the detection of the HC3N line with S/N>10.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Maps of DC3N 10-9 in OMC-2 FIR4
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Obtain maps of the DC3N 10-9 line towards OMC-2 FIR4. The H-13-C3N falls in the same band.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The line widths for L1544 and L1527 are about 1.5 km/s.
We request an angular resolution of 2arcsec so that we will be able to disentangle the emission from the envelope and the clump-sources of OMC-2 FIR4.

We request an rms of 4mJy over a 0.5 km/s bin, based on the IRAM-30m single-dish observations. Specifically, the computed total flux is of 390 mJy. Assuming a source extent of 10" leads to a flux on the 2" ALMA beam of 15 mJy. The 4mJy rms will ensure the detection of the DC3N line with about S/N=4 in the regions with the weakest line flux.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Map of HC3N 10-9 in OMC-2 FIR4
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Obtain map of the HC3N 10-9 line towards OMC-2 FIR4.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The line widths for L1544 and L1527 are about 1.5 km/s.

We request an angular resolution of 2arcsec so that we will be able to disentangle the emission from the disk versus the envelope in L1527. In L1544, we expect more extended structures so that we may, if necessary, reduce the angular resolution by smoothing over a larger beam.

We request an rms of 10mJy over a 0.5 km/s bin, based on the IRAM-30m single-dish observations. Specifically, the computed total flux is 4Jy. Assuming a source extent of 10" leads to a flux on the 2" ALMA beam of 180mJy. The 10mJy rms will ensure the detection of the HC3N line with S/N>10.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: Deuteration is a powerful diagnostic tool to understand the early phases of the Solar System formation. This proposal focuses on the deuteration of cyanoacetylene (HC3N), a major precursor of organic material in comets and meteorites. The goal is to obtain maps of the HC3N/DC3N abundance ratio in three sources that represent early phases of solar type star formation: L1544, L1527 and OMC-2 FIR4. They have been selected based on the detection of the DC3N in the framework of the IRAM-30m Large Program ASAI and on their capacity to represent different evolutionary phases. We propose to obtain maps of the HC3N and DC3N 10-9 lines, in order to accurately measure the DC3N/HC3N abundance ratio in the different components in the line of sight of the selected sources.
